wikipedia_page.main: Hazel Alden Reason (April 1901 – 1976) was an English chemist who became a schoolteacher. She was the author of a popular book for young people on the history of chemistry.

response: *Hazel Alden Reason (1901–1976), English chemist and science writer
* Hazel Alden Reason (1901–1976), chemist and popular science writer, was born in Friern Barnet.

For the last 20 years of her life at least, Joyce Reason, a Congregationalist by denomination, lived at 102 Addison Rd, Guildford. She was not married and for much of her life lived with her younger sister, the chemist and teacher Hazel Alden Reason, who was also unmarried.
